Articles.Content:
<p>* * * * * * * * * * * * <img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/39de658ee31826ed4203c7c4702550c1/tumblr_inline_mxr7j1KSLc1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><span>Squad has donated a sum of $5000 to*</span><strong><a href="https://www.facebook.com/MisionMexicoChildren" data-hovercard="/ajax/hovercard/page.php?id=211528332193484&extragetparams=%7B%22directed_target_id%22%3A0%7D">Mision Mexico</a></strong><span>.*</span><br/><br/><span>They are an organization that provides a loving and stable home for children of all ages who have been abused, neglected, orphaned or abandoned.*</span><br/><br/><span>We encourage you to do the same. It will go a long way to help the Mexican community.</span><br/><br/><strong><a href="http://www.facebook.com/l.php?u=http%3A%2F%2Flovelifehope.com%2F&h=eAQH6PavY&enc=AZNJKFD9jqwi_wJ757VjK-b-VPvxEhf3uZjh6ZxJymKCZFHUFL-a9xmki4AK1g0_fqYOZ6gsQ2qy_1lV4FpIXn_RfGWr2FfGNbYovXD80WtQfgCXta7j3fMBbYnWXfnU--ne0_laVjaLPgwnQrE1xeQy&s=1" rel="nofollow nofollow" target="_blank"><a href="http://lovelifehope.com/">http://lovelifehope.com/</a></a></strong></p>

Awwww. Go SQUAD!

-Duxwing
You guys... That was just nice.
A noble deed indeed.

Nice to think that part of it was earned with my purchase of the game.

Now that's a damm well spent money, congrats.
Thats a very nice idea!
May the good deed be with you, Squad.
you guys are very nice
Good move, +1.

This is great. Recently I've watched a documentary about the nutritional habits in Mexico, especially in rural areas. People seem to drink nothing but Coca-Cola there because it's very cheap and because of monopoly. Even the schools offer tacos, junk food, Cola, all day long. Obesity has skyrocketed in the last two decades.

Squad, this is a great move on your behalf and I'm sure it will provide many kids with proper meals in proper homes.

Squad has donated a sum of $5000.

We encourage you to do the same.

A fairly tall order
That was really noble of you. Go Squad!
Imagine if Squad gave $1 to this organisation for every copy of KSP sold, it would be a hell of alot more than $5k, but kudos to them, anything is better than nothing.

Imagine if Squad gave $1 to this organisation for every copy of KSP sold, it would be a hell of alot more than $5k, but kudos to them, anything is better than nothing.

Imagine if you gave 3.7% of your monthly income to charity. Gross take-home, before taxes or expenses.

Pretty easy to be generous with other peoples money.

------------

Kudos to you guys at Squad. Seems to be a very worthy charity.

Imagine if you gave 3.7% of your monthly income to charity. Gross take-home, before taxes or expenses.

Pretty easy to be generous with other peoples money.

------------

Kudos to you guys at Squad. Seems to be a very worthy charity.

I actually give quite a bit more than that monthly to charity, it's probably closer to 5%, and that's a single person versus a company, so it's apples and oranges. Just because someone doesn't create a thread and tells everyone about it, doesn't mean it's something they don't do regularly.

My point wasn't negative Tiberion my friend, I was simply saying imagine if they did, I dare say the monthly hopper at squad is significantly larger than my measly piggy bank

Edited December 14, 2013 by Devo
added apples and oranges
Thumbs up Squad

Am I the only one who thought "Mission Mexico" was some sort of new aerospace company in Mexico before reading the actual post?

On a more on-topic note, it's always nice to see money going to a charity.

Am I the only one who thought "Mission Mexico" was some sort of new aerospace company in Mexico before reading the actual post?

On a more on-topic note, it's always nice to see money going to a charity.

hehe I did actually, but was glad to see it was to a greater cause. (not that launching mexican rockets into space wouldn't be a great cause, but it would be a tad expensive!)
this shows squad really cares about people in need
Well done, that's the spirit
